com.faltro.houdoku.controller

Class SeriesController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.faltro.houdoku.controller.Controller
      • com.faltro.houdoku.controller.SeriesController

  • public class SeriesController
extends Controller
    The controller for the series page.

    The FXML file for this view is at resources/fxml/series.fxml

    See Also:
    Controller

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Initialize the components of the controller's view.

        This method binds the size of components as appropriate using this class' static variables. It creates and sets the cell factory and cell value factory for the columns in the chapters table.

        Overrides:
        initialize in class Controller
        See Also:
        Controller.initialize()

      • refreshContent

        public void refreshContent()
        Refreshes the data of content fields using current this.series info.

      • newCellClickHandler

        private javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> newCellClickHandler()
        Creates a standard MouseEvent "click handler" for a table cell.

        The event checks for a double left click. When it happens, it identifies the chapter of the selected row and changes the scene to the reader with the specified chapter.

        Returns:
        a standard MouseEvent EventHandler for a table cell

      • newStringCellFactory

        private javafx.util.Callback<javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Chapter,java.lang.String>,javafx.scene.control.TableCell<Chapter,java.lang.String>> newStringCellFactory(javafx.beans.property.ReadOnlyDoubleProperty widthProperty)
        Creates a Callback of a standard cell factory for a table cell.

        The cell factory represents the String content as a JavaFX Text object using the "tableText" style class. The cell is given a click handler from newCellClickHandler().

        Parameters:
        widthProperty - the widthProperty of this cell's column
        Returns:
        a Callback of a standard cell factory for a table cell

      • toggleInfo

        public void toggleInfo()
        Toggles whether or not the info container is displayed.

        This method also automatically forces the content to fill up the available space, as appropriate based on whether the info container is visible.

        Called exclusively by toggleInfoButton

      • goToLibrary

        public void goToLibrary()
        Change to the library scene.

        Called exclusively by toLibraryButton

        See Also:
        LibraryController, toLibraryButton

      • setSeries

        public void setSeries(Series series)
